channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13755] Provide single super user check implementation
item.description: Followup for HBASE-13375.
item.summary: Provide single super user check implementation

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This is what new class I thought


class Authentication** { // Not getting a name



//singleton instance

private List<String> superUsers, superGroups;



public static initialize(Configuration){

 // initialize super user/group lists here

}



public static getInstance() {

  // throw RTE when called before initialize

}



public boolean isSuperUser(User){



}



//Group related utils.

public static isGroup()

public static getGroupName()



}
Thanks Anoop, I'll post the patch here soon.
Here's v1 patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12736701/HBASE-13755-v1.patch
against master branch at commit dcc711fff2341402c52095fc7db92df597ec58c4.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12736701

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 16 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 1928 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 1927 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14257//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14257//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14257//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14257//console

This message is automatically generated.

TestDistributedLogSplitting looks unrelated

Failed to read test report file /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/hbase-server/target/surefire-reports/TEST-org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestDistributedLogSplitting.xml

org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 85 of document file:///home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/hbase-server/target/surefire-reports/TEST-org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestDistributedLogSplitting.xml : XML document structures must start and end within the same entity. Nested exception: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity.

I'll fix checkstyle in next patch, will also change audience on Superusers class to Private. Anoop Sam John I ended up making it static-field class rather then singleton as it seems the only method we need to open to the world is 'isSuperUser()' and we don't seem to really need getInstance() for that. What do you think?

As long as we can throw Exception when used before initialize(Conf) it is fine. Am not sure whether the new class name is correct.. Am not good in naming..

checkSystemOrSuperUser(Configuration conf)
Now conf is of no use. Just avoid passing as param

if (superUsers == null || superGroups == null) {
May be superUsers == null check would be enough. Pls say in javadoc abt throws case

@InterfaceAudience.Public
Do we need to expose it as Public interface. Keep it private IMO.

Thanks for taking a look!

As long as we can throw Exception when used before initialize(Conf) it is fine

Could you elaborate? We're throwing 


if (superUsers == null || superGroups == null) {

 throw new IOException("Super users/super groups lists haven't been initialized properly,");

}

If lists haven't been initialized properly?

I'll address other comments in next version of patch - thanks for review. Will make it Private - my oversight. Regarding the naming - I can't come up with a better name either so I'd say - unless someone jumps in and suggest better name, let's commit as Superusers, as long as it's Private it should be no problem to open a new renaming jira as soon as someone finds better name

Could you elaborate? We're throwing

Yes, I mean as long as we throw Exception and not silently give wrong results from isSuperUser(User) , I am fine. So this is just fine for me.
Thanks Anoop - I'll post new patch tonight.
here's v2 with notes addressed, how's it?

You think the failures related Mikhail Antonov? I requeued anyways...

I think they aren't, as the only change I made in v3 compared to v2 (which passed all tests but failed on checkstyle) was that I made new Superusers class final.

Specifically, this doesn't look legit:


Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 463.408 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport

testImport94Table(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport)  Time elapsed: 0.075 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.io.FileNotFoundException: File /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build%402/hbase-server/target/test-classes/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/exportedTableIn94Format does not exist

Also this run - https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14317/

was for different patch, and exact same tests failed w/ the same error. I suspect there's some instability introduced in the master. I'll try to reproduce some of those errors locally tonight.

This is not related to this patch I believe. I have seen this failure with some other QA run also.
Can I get one more +1? ping stack, Srikanth Srungarapu

Patch looks good to me. Minor nit:
Moving GROUP_PREFIX constant to Superusers seems misleading, as it has broader applicability.


 /** Prefix character to denote group names */

public static final String GROUP_PREFIX = "@";

Thanks Anoop Sam John and Srikanth Srungarapu

Srikanth Srungarapu I agree, and I think that point was raised and discussed in HBASE-13375.. I had to move it from hbase-server to somewhere in hbase-common to make it accessible, and User class doesn't seem to be very good fit either. So I decided to keep it here (at least for now).
You can add a comment explaining why we are going with this choice for now.

Hm.. Actually I would say this constant could be viewed just naturally belonging to this class (or at least having it in this class looks not less logical than having it in class AccessControlLists to me), as parsing hbase-site.xml to populate caches is it's primary purpose? The only other place (besides tests) where this constant is used it TableAuthManager.

I'm a bit uncertain here about adding comments explaining why certain stuff is placed to certain class - if people think that having this constant in this class looks misleading, then supposedly there should be a place where it would look much more natural, in which case let's just move it there?

I thought originally about putting it in HConstants, but comment there says (rightfully) - "// NOTICE!!!! Please do not add a constants here, unless they are referenced by a lot of classes.". Which is not the case here.
I also filed HBASE-13862 for TestRegionRebalancing.

Formally -1 on the patch in the current form.

  • IMHO, SuperUsers is a misnomer. There are a couple of methods namely public static String getGroupName(String aclKey) and public static boolean isGroupPrincipal(String name), which don't have anything to do with superusers.
  • May be you can add them to existing AuthUtil in hbase-common module.
I didn't really notice this class.. Ya looks it better suits to AuthUtil...

IMHO, SuperUsers is a misnomer.

I should say I don't like this name, but so far wasn't able to come with a better one I'd be glad to rename if someone has better name in mind.

Regarding where to put methods and constants - I'm not sure it can properly fit at any of the places I went through, so I guess yeah, let's just put them wherever it causes least debate. I'll move it in AuthUtil as you suggested Srikanth Srungarapu. Anoop Sam John - does it work for you?
Yes I agree.
here's updated patch

+1
Srikanth Srungarapu If you are also +1, can you pls commit this?

Superusers class is throwing IOException at couple of places can we instead throw something else may be IllegalArgumentException or IllegalStateException or something else but not IOE as it no where related to I/O.

Good point. I actually just left these IOExceptions in place mostly to avoid having to modify callers which catch IOExceptions.

I can definitely remove IOException from isSuperUser() method and replace it with illegalstateexception. In initialize() method, we have User.getCurrent() call inside, which throws IOException anyway.. not sure it'd good idea to catch it and re-translate to something else. Should we leave IOException in initialize() method and replace in isSuperUser()?

I mentioned that point to avoid remarks of this kind .

In initialize() method, we have User.getCurrent() call inside, which throws IOException anyway.. not sure it'd good idea to catch it and re-translate to something else

Lets not catch any exception thrown from an existing method and re-translate it to something else but instead lets not throw IOE by ourselves when user is null.
That makes sense. Let me rework the patch.

here's v5 patch with suggestion on IOException incorporated.

Ashish Singhi, Srikanth Srungarapu how does it look?

v5 patch lgtm other than one minor nit (which committer can correct while committing the patch if he is willing to and if there is no other comments on the patch).

+ throw new IllegalStateException("Super users/super groups lists"
+ + " haven't been initialized properly,");

End the exception message with '.' instead of ','.

It is better to keep all group related methods together. Can we also move toGroupEntry to AuthUtil? Also, lets reuse this method, whenever we need to prepend AuthUtil.GROUP_PREFIX to string. Other than that, the patch is looking great.
v6 with feedback above; it looks like group_prefix constant can now be made private, but left it public for now as javadoc in TableAuthManager refers it and explains what is being returned.

Mikhail Antonov you may have to rebase the patch due to change in TAC2 as part of HBASE-13828.

Fixed AC related merge issues and pushed to master. Looks like branch-1 has issues with VC and QOS related classes. Now that you have additional privileges, I guess you can push things yourself . Once done, please don't forget to update fix version.

Thanks! Yeah, I'll push to the other branches as needed I believe we only need it in 1.2 (branch-1), or 1.0 and 1.1 as well?
My suggestion would be to port them to 1.0 and 1.1 as we need to get HBASE-10619 into these branches.
Right. Pinging Enis Soztutar, Nick Dimiduk, Sean Busbey to check.

I think this patch would be fine in all the branch-1s, since it doesn't change any part of the API or the system's behavior. I don't think HBASE-10619 should be in 1.0 or 1.1; I'll go put that commentary on that ticket.

See Sean's comment over in HBASE-10619. I am also +1 for that. So this Jira can be committed to 1.2 only.
As this is not a bug fix, I would say don't change patch versions. Any way not so strong on that. +0
Here's patch for branch-1. Tests for o.a.h.h.security.access.* and .visibility.* packages passed locally.

Skimmed the branch-1 patch, probably is okay for branch-1.1 and branch-1.0 assuming it applies cleanly. My concern is if the new class changes any semantics (like, exceptions). I'll be kicking branch-1.1 for API incompatibilities anyway, so I can check this one while I'm at it.

Want to post a patch for us? Thanks Mikhail Antonov.
Anoop Sam John which of Sean's comments are you referencing? This one? I think he's talking about HBASE-10619, not this ticket. I don't see any behavior changes in this patch – do I have that wrong?

Nick Dimiduk yeah, I'll try to make patch for branch-1.1 (assuming that needed changes are there). Though this is kind of spinoff from HBASE-13375, which only went to 1.2 and master, and HBASE-10619 is also aimed to 1.2+, not exactly sure how useful it would be.
As a side note (maybe easier to ask here) - how could I run custom branch patch on ASF jenkins?
if you name the patch file as JIRA-XXXX-branchname.rev.patch then test-patch should properly test on the alternate branch. i.e HBASE-13755-branch-1.1.6.patch
Thanks Sean Busbey!

As Anoop Sam John says above, I think it's okay to omit this from branch-1.{0,1} since it's not a bug fix. Simply in mind of making back porting other bug fixes easier, I like to bring things back if we can.
branch-1.1 patch. Note that branch-1 and branch-1.1 patches have additional deprecated method in Superusers to allows checks using String username (to support backward-comp. callers).
renamed branch-1 patch to allow it to be picked up by buildbot

Anoop Sam John which of Sean's comments are you referencing? This one? I think he's talking about HBASE-10619, not this ticket. I don't see any behavior changes in this patch – do I have that wrong?

I mean this. The reasoning for this jira to be pushed to patch branches was to get HBASE-10619 there. As we can not add HBASE-10619 in patch branches, committing this jira to patch branches is not so important.
